definition[0]: to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time
example[0]: It is unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate wealth.
definition[1]: to gradually increase in numbers or amount until there is a large quantity in one place
example[1]: Fat tends to accumulate around the hips and thighs.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say build up rather than accumulate:
example[2]: These chemicals tend to build up in the soil.
definition[2]: to get, earn, or obtain something gradually over a period of time
example[4]: A lot of companies have accumulated significant debts.
definition[3]: to increase or develop gradually over a period of time
example[5]: the funds that had accumulated in their accounts
example[6]: The arrears have been accumulating since last year.
